instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.I2C_PWR_SCL: What is I2C_PWR_SCL? I2C_PWR_SCL is the clock line of the SMBUS data line between the system management controller(SMC), battery, ISL9240 battery charging chip, and power management unit(PMU). This line is necessary for the machine to communicate with the battery, see the battery, and use the battery. When this line is malfunctioning or shorted to ground, the machine will have an X icon over the battery and not run off the battery. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Hey i have a Problem  with a Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. 

Suddenly dead no water dmg, board looks like new.

No Voltage at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>.

I replaced <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> but changed nothing.

What i need to do next, any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any reason to change <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>?
Can we know actual <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?

Thank you very much,

Well i thought it was the IC, cause i have no output voltages there.
And i am a beginner in MacBook repairs. I do more Smartphone Logicboard repairs.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
It is the first voltage you need to get.
Check diode mode to ground there.
If good, post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead

I did from beginning, no short there.


<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>= 1,3 V
VDDA/P= 5V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>=0V
A/BMON= 0V

You probably need to change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>...

Thank you so far

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
T2 boards have different power on sequence than old boards.
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> comes from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>...

Some ideas now ? the short is fixxed now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> MUST generate <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without any control from T2; even with just 5V from USB-C input.
Compare diode mode to ground at pin 2/F7000 with good board.

Consider to change <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40 and check R/<CAPACITOR>C7030</CAPACITOR>/40.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
That means <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is not properly controlled.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> needs to communicate with T2 for this.

You may have a problem with I2C battery bus, or T2 corrupted software.
Try DFU revive first.
If no important SSD data, go for restore; if revive didn't help.

If can't enter DFU, check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages come on; at corresponding small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

i checked the awake and slps2r lines they are fine too. 

I hope you have some new ideas for me.

and sorry i am a beginner in Macbook repairs

threads.message: i think i did all correctly. I short 1V8 to Force DFU and connect typ C cable to host macbook. I did one more measurement and noticed that the macbook havent voltages when the battery is connected. What do you think about that? I have only when the cable is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Connect both charger and battery for DFU.
Some machines don't complete DFU without battery.
Be sure to use dedicated USB-C port for DFU.
